page.title: 01Some facts about Ombersley
page.content: Ombersley is a very peaceful{village near the River Severn and the city of Worcester. Most of the land around Ombersley is used for{farming.}There are quite a few shops, pubs and places to eat in Ombersley compared to other villages. Also there are some quite famous{black {and white buildings}in Ombersley like the Dower House and the King's Arms pub which are{tourist attractions . There is also a famous private house, owned by Lord Sandys, which was built in the early 18th Century and which is called{Ombersley Court. In 1972 a by-pass was built on the east side of the village. The whole parish of Ombersley covers 7000 acres. It is the third largest parish in the old county of Worcestershire. There are about 2000 people in the parish of Ombersley.
